documentType: Bureau of Prisons count sheet and inmate roster
summary: This document consists of official Bureau of Prisons count sheets and an inmate roster from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 8, 2019. It records inmate counts by housing unit and lists specific inmate assignments, including two named inmates in a hospital assignment. The document appears to be routine prison administrative records from the date Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.

persons.name: Noboa
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 91349-053 assigned to the hospital (HOSP) on the inmate roster dated August 8, 2019.

persons.name: Weber
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 85377-054 assigned to the hospital (HOSP) on the inmate roster dated August 8, 2019.

events.title: Daily inmate count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine official inmate count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, recording a total census of 759 inmates distributed across various housing units.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is dated August 8, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
It shows a total inmate census of 759 at the MCC on that date.
An inmate roster lists two inmates, Noboa and Weber, with hospital (HOSP) assignments.
The document is a routine administrative prison record, specifically count sheets and an assignment roster.
No direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein is made in the provided text excerpts.
